channel.title: Gateway: Firewall shutdown
channel.description: I wanna establish a SSH tunnel from inside the gateway which is mentioned in https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tunnel_Tor_through_proxy_or_VPN_or_SSH#Tunnel_Tor_through_VPN To do some tests i wanna shot down the firewall. First i stopped TOR on the Whonix-Gateway. To shut down the firewall i did the following with root privilege. Iptables -F Iptables -P INPUT ACCEPT Iptables -P OUTPUT ACCEPT The problem is that i cant establish a ssh connection. The error message i get is: Connection refused It seems the firewall still blocks connections. How do i solve this problem?

item.title: Gateway: Firewall shutdown
item.dc:creator: Silance
item.description:
Thanks for the fast response and for the script.
Will check it out later.

Read full topic

item.title: Gateway: Firewall shutdown
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
For firewall unload, try this script that I just now added to the wiki:

Whonix

Dev/Firewall Unload

How to unload / remove each and every iptables rule.

Use user clearnet, that is allowed.

Or allow in Whonix firewall settings to allow user “user” or user “root” to connect to clearnet.

Read full topic

item.title: Gateway: Firewall shutdown
item.dc:creator: Silance
item.description:
I wanna establish a SSH tunnel from inside the gateway which is mentioned in https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tunnel_Tor_through_proxy_or_VPN_or_SSH#Tunnel_Tor_through_VPN
To do some tests i wanna shot down the firewall.
First i stopped TOR on the Whonix-Gateway.
To shut down the firewall i did the following with root privilege.
Iptables -F
Iptables -P INPUT ACCEPT
Iptables -P OUTPUT ACCEPT
The problem is that i cant establish a ssh connection. The error message i get is: Connection refused
It seems the firewall still blocks connections.
How do i solve this problem?

Read full topic
